intro: Polyosma forbesii, commonly known as Forbes' polyosma, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically visited by native bees and other pollinators. The species is often found in dry, open forests and woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
